title: Robyn Lawley strips NAKED for Marie Claire's sustainability issue
text:
Robyn Lawley has stripped naked for the latest issue of Marie Claire Australia, which is dedicated to the issue of sustainability.

The 30-year-old model is a passionate advocate for environmental issues as well as size diversity on the fashion runway.

Posing for the artistic photo shoot, Robyn sits completely nude on a beach while covering her modesty with a strategically-placed right arm.

Scroll down for video

For a good cause: Robyn Lawley has stripped naked for the latest issue of Marie Claire Australia, which is dedicated to the issue of sustainability

Another image shows Robyn in an evening dress floating on her back in the ocean, gazing up towards the sky.

For the magazine's cover, she looks elegant in a one-shoulder blue swimsuit while sitting on a wooden jetty.

In an Instagram post on Wednesday, Robyn revealed she didn't think twice about baring all for a worthwhile cause.

Blue crush: For the magazine's cover, she looks elegant in a one-shoulder blue swimsuit while sitting on a wooden jetty

Robyn said she was grateful for the opportunity to raise awareness of the environmental issues affecting the Great Barrier Reef.

'What an opportunity... I remember this [nude] shot being taken, and saying under my breath, "Anything for you, Mother Nature,"' she wrote.

'I was in more of a panic when I saw the level of bleaching [of coral on the Reef].'

Going with the flow: Another image shows Robyn in an evening dress floating on her back in the ocean, gazing up towards the sky

Robyn added that she had last visited the Great Barrier Reef in Queensland just a few years ago with her longtime partner Everest Schmidt.

She said the level of coral bleaching that had occurred since then as a result of global warming shocked her.

'We need to protect her, so many species rely on the health of the Reef and other reefs around the world, not to mention ourselves,' she wrote.

Speaking out: The 30-year-old model is a passionate advocate for environmental issues as well as size diversity on the fashion runway

'As a planet we are connected. Global warming damages a huge part as does... pesticide runoff, illegal fishing or poor fishing practices.

'Runoff from nearby coal mines and other fossil fuels [also cause damage]. Shipping ports right near the Reef...'

She urged visitors to the area to collect any rubbish they come across, and also encouraged them to 'demand more action' from the government.
